info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 4:59PM EDT until August 04 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Schenectady County in east central New York... Northwestern Albany County in east central New York... Eastern Schoharie County in east central New York... Southeastern Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Middleburgh, or 8 miles southeast of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Rotterdam, Scotia, Guilderland, Duanesburg, Berne, Voorheesville, Altamont, Middleburgh, Schoharie, Delanson, Rotterdam Junction, Livingstonville, Central Bridge, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, New Scotland, Knox, Princetown, Carlisle and Rensselaerville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
